item.title: steven add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "There are two ways of spreading light: to be The candle or the mirror that reflects it." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: steven add a quote by Henry Ford
item.description: "I cannot discover that anyone knows enough to say definitely what is and what is not possible." -- Henry Ford

item.title: steven add a quote by Charles mingus
item.description: " Making the simple complicated is commonplace; making the complicated simple, awesomely simple, thatâ€™s creative." -- Charles mingus

item.title: steven add a quote by Epicurus
item.description: "Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for." -- Epicurus

item.title: steven add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones." -- William Faulkner

item.title: steven add a quote by Josh Billings
item.description: "Consider the postage stamp: its usefulness consists in the ability to stick to one thing till it gets there." -- Josh Billings

item.title: steven add a quote by Clifton Fadiman
item.description: "When you reread a classic you do not see more in the book than you did before; you see more in you than there was before." -- Clifton Fadiman

item.title: steven add a quote by G. Pascal Zachary
item.description: "Highly creative people don't necessarily excel in raw brainpower. They are misfits on some level. They tend to question accepted views and to consider contradictory ones." -- G. Pascal Zachary

item.title: steven add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't." -- Mark Twain
